item.title: How to Create a Minecraft Server with AWS
item.description:
WHY

I want to learn something about AWS, SSH remote connection.

I want to play Minecraft with my friends.

WHAT

AWS Introduction

SSH Intro

HOW

* means Optional Operation

1. Create am AWS EC2 Instance

  • AWS Price Calculator: A Pure Minecraft with Two People Server needs at least 1 GiB RAM.
  • t3.small is recommended for 2-3 people playing pure Minecraft without mod.

2. Connect Linux to the Instance with SSH

  1. Create a new key pair: rsa, and store your .pem file.

  2. Open port 22 for SSH connection.

    1. Create a new Security Group
    2. Inbound rules: Open TCP port 22 (SSH) and 25565 (Minecraft Server)
    3. Outbound rules: All traffic to internet connection.

  3. $ ssh -i PATH_TO_PEM ec2-user@IPV4

3. Install Java & Minecraft Server to the Instance

1.1 Install Java 8: $ sudo yum install java-1.8.0

2.1 Download Server Package(1.16.5): $ wget https://launcher.mojang.com/v1/objects/1b557e7b033b583cd9f66746b7a9ab1ec1673ced/server.jar

2.2 First Launch: $ java -jar server.jar nogui

2.3 Accept EULA: 1. Open eula.txt: $ vim eula.txt, 2. Change eula=false to eula=true to indicate acceptance of the EULA

2.4* Install forge version: $ wget https://maven.minecraftforge.net/net/minecraftforge/forge/1.16.5-36.2.34/forge-1.16.5-36.2.34-installer.jar and run $ java -jar forge-1.16.5-36.2.34-installer.jar --installServer

4. Launch the Server & Commands

  • Launch Pure or Forge version $ java -Xmx1536M -Xms512M -jar SERVER_NAME.jar nogui
    • -Xmx1024M is maximum RAM allow server to use
    • -Xms1024M is minimum RAM allow server to use
    • Or you can launch by systemd: sudo touch /etc/systemd/system/minecraft.service, sudo chmod 664 /etc/systemd/system/minecraft.service, sudo vim /etc/systemd/system/minecraft.service, sudo systemctl daemon-reload
[Service]
User=ec2-user
WorkingDirectory=/home/ec2-user/minecraft
ReadWriteDirectories=/home/ec2-user/minecraft
ExecStart=java -Xmx1536M -Xms512M -jar /home/ec2-user/minecraft/server.jar nogui
ExecStop=/stop
  • Stop the Server: /stop
